data.title: The Doctors
data.meta_description: The Doctors You can read more about the classic Doctor episodes at BBC here. This site is a fan site and is in no way official or associated with the BBC. data.text:
You can read more about the classic Doctor episodes at BBC here. This site is a fan site and is in no way official or associated with the BBC.

Before I go on, let me just quickly address one small controversy. Doctor Who or Dr. Who? Both are correct. At various times the TV show credits have listed not only Doctor Who and Dr. Who but The Doctor with no Who. ğŸ™‚ So if someone gives you grief, point them to Google. ğŸ™‚

Their Tenure

Here is a list of the actors who previously portrayed the good Doctor, current as of October 2022, giving the years they portrayed the Doctor.

John Hurtâ€™s regeneration of the Doctor is the cause of the destruction of Gallifrey in one timeline. This does not happen, but he cannot remember the changed timeline. As Steven Moffat has said the numbering of the Doctors remains the same, I have numbered John Hurtâ€™s War Doctor as #8.5. This is not official.

Then there was #14. David Tennant reprises his role as the Doctor, taking over from Jodie Whitaker. It remains to be seen how things progress to #15 who has already been announced and if the numbering system will be as Iâ€™ve noted it here today.

#1 â€“ William Hartnell (Nov 1963- Oct 66)

*side note: After William Hartnell died, two actors portrayed the first doctor. Richard Hurndall (in The Five Doctors) and David Bradley (in The Doctor Falls and Twice Upon a Time)

#2 â€“ Patrick Troughton (Nov 1966 â€“ June 69)

#3 â€“ Jon Pertwee (Jan 1970 â€“ June 74)

#4 â€“ Tom Baker (Dec 1974 â€“ March 81)

#5 â€“ Peter Davison (Jan 1982 â€“ March 84)

#6 â€“ Colin Baker (March 1984 â€“ Dec 86)

#7 â€“ Sylvester McCoy (Sept 1987- Dec 89)

#8 â€“ Paul McGann (May 1996)

#8.5 John Hurt the War Doctor (May 2013-Nov 2013)

#9 â€“ Christopher Eccleston (March to June 2005)

#10 â€“ David Tennant (Nov 2005- Jan 2010)

#11 â€“ Matt Smith (April 2010 â€“ December 2013)

#12 â€“ Peter Capaldi (December 2013 â€“ December 2017)

#13 â€“ Jodie Whittaker (December 2017 â€“ October 2022 )

#14 â€“ David Tennant (October 2022 â€“ ? Supposed last appearance in Dec 2023)

#15 â€“ Ncuti Gatwa (Dec 2023 â€“ )

In â€œFugitive of the Judoonâ€ a new Doctor was introduced but I donâ€™t know yet where this Doctor fits in. When more is known Iâ€™ll add the pertinent information.

#?? â€“ Jo Martin as Ruth Clayton/ The Doctor â€“ (January 2020)

Number of Episodes per Doctor

The episode count is my own and also not official. I count main series and do not count mini-episodes and guest appearances in other doctorâ€™s series unless noted. The first classic episodes were shorter than todayâ€™s episodes. Each classic series episode was approximately 25 minutes of transmission length in 1963-64 and 1986-89), was approximately 45 minutes in 1984 and from 2005 to the present. There were also additional specials at various lengths.

Doctors #1, 2 and 3 appeared in The Three Doctors (part of S10 of Pertweeâ€™s series) and Doctors #1-5 appeared in The Five Doctors (20th anniversary special during Davisonâ€™s series) with Hurndall replacing Hartnell who had died . Doctor #1 as played by David Bradley appears in The Doctor Falls and Twice Upon a Time.

#1 â€“ William Hartnell 134 episodes

#2 â€“ Patrick Troughton 119 episodes

#3 â€“ Jon Pertwee 128 episodes

#4 â€“ Tom Baker 172 episodes (173 if you count SHADA)

#5 â€“ Peter Davison 69 episodes (inc The Five Doctors 20th anniv special)

#6 â€“ Colin Baker 31 episodes

#7 â€“ Sylvester McCoy 42 episodes

#8 â€“ Paul McGann 1 movie (I have to note the important mini-episode The Night of the Doctor featuring the regeneration scene)

#8.5 John Hurt the War Doctor 1 episode The Day of the Doctor, 50th-anniversary special, and mini-episode The Night of the Doctor

#9 â€“ Christopher Eccleston 13 episodes

#10 â€“ David Tennant 47 episodes (39 eps and 8 specials, 2 animated not counted), episodes as #14 will be counted separately

#11 â€“ Matt Smith 44 episodes (39 eps and 5 specials)

#12 â€“ Peter Capaldi 40 episodes (36 eps and 4 specials)

#13 â€“ Jodie Whittaker 31 (26 episodes, 5 specials) (Note: filming during pandemic)

#14 â€“ David Tennant 3 specials in 2023

#15 â€“ Ncuti Gatwa

First and Last Episodes

#1 â€“ William Hartnell â€“ first An Unearthly Child, last The Tenth Planet

#2 â€“ Patrick Troughton â€“ first The Power of the Daleks, last The War Games

#3 â€“ Jon Pertwee â€“ first Spearhead from Space, last Planet of the Spiders

#4 â€“ Tom Baker â€“ first Robot, last Logopolis

#5 â€“ Peter Davison â€“ first Castrovalva, last Caves of Androzani

#6 â€“ Colin Baker â€“ first The Twin Dilemma, last The Ultimate Foe

#7 â€“ Sylvester McCoy â€“ first Time and the Rani, last Doctor Who the Movie

#8 â€“ Paul McGann â€“ Doctor Who (the movie), appeared in mini-episode Night of the Doctor

#8.5 John Hurt (The War Doctor) â€“ first The Night of the Doctor mini-episode, first complete episode The Name of the Doctor, last Day of the Doctor

#9 â€“ Christopher Eccleston â€“ first Rose, last Parting of the Ways

#10 â€“ David Tennant â€“ first The Christmas Invasion, last The End of Time

#11 â€“ Matt Smith â€“ first The Eleventh Hour, last Christmas Special: Time of the Doctor

#12 â€“ Peter Capaldi â€“ first Time of the Doctor, last Christmas Special: Twice Upon a Time

#13 â€“ Jodie Whittaker â€“ first The Woman Who Fell to Earth, last The Power of the Doctor

#14 â€“ David Tennant â€“ first as #14 The Power of the Doctor, last? in The Giggle

#15 â€“ Ncuti Gatwa â€“ first in The Giggle,

First words

#1 â€“ â€œWhat are you doing here?â€

#2- â€œSlower! Slower! Concentrate on one thing. One thing!â€

#3 â€“ â€œShoes. Must find my shoes. Unhand me, madam!â€

#4 â€“ Human history.â€ â€œI tell you Brigadier, thereâ€™s nothing to worry about. The brontosaurus is large and placid.â€

#5 â€“ Ah. Youâ€™ve come to help me find the Zero Room. Welcome aboard. Iâ€™m the Doctor. Or will be if this regeneration works out.â€

#6 â€“ â€œYou were expecting someone else?â€

#7 â€“ â€œOh no, Mel.â€ â€œThat was a nice nap. Now down to business.â€

#8 â€“ â€œWho am I? Who am I?â€

#8.5 â€“ â€œDoctor no more.â€

#9 â€“ â€œRun!â€

#10 â€“ â€œHello! Okay. Ooh. New teeth. Thatâ€™s weird. So, where was I? Oh, thatâ€™s right. Barcelona!â€

#11 â€“ â€œLegs! Iâ€™ve still got legs!! Good. Arms, hands. Ooh, fingers. Lots of fingers. Ears? Yes. Eyes: too. Nose. Iâ€™ve had worse. Chin â€“ blimey! Hair. Iâ€™m a girl! No! No! Iâ€™m not a girl! And still not ginger! Thereâ€™s something else. Somethingâ€¦ important, Iâ€™mâ€¦ Iâ€™m..Iâ€™mâ€¦ Ha-ha! Crashing! haha Woohoohoo Geronimo!â€

#12 â€“ â€œKidneys! Iâ€™ve got new kidneys! I donâ€™t like the colour. â€¦Weâ€™re probably crashing! Ohh! Stay calm. Just one question: Do you happen to know how to fly this thing?â€

#13 â€“ â€œOh! Brilliant!â€

#14 â€“ â€œI know these teeth. What? What? What?â€

#15 â€“ â€œNo way!â€

Last words

#1 â€“ William Hartnell â€œAh, yes! Itâ€™s good! Thank you. Keep warm.â€

David Bradley in â€œTwice Upon a Timeâ€ â€¦ Well, then. Here we go. The long way around.â€

#2 â€“ â€œNo! Stop, youâ€™re making me giddy! No, you canâ€™t do this to me! No, no, no, no, no, no â€¦â€

#3 â€“ â€œA tear, Sarah Jane? No, donâ€™t cry. While thereâ€™s life thereâ€™s â€¦â€

#4 â€“ â€œItâ€™s the end. But the moment has been prepared for.â€

#5 â€“ â€œI might regenerate. I donâ€™t know. Feels different this time â€¦ Adric?â€

#6 â€“ â€œOhhâ€¦ carrot juice? Carrot juice, carrot juice, carrot juice.â€

#7 â€“ â€œTiming malfunction! The Master. Heâ€™s out there! Heâ€™s out there. Iâ€™ve got to stopâ€¦him.â€ (regeneration in 1996 movie)

In last aired episode of the original series (Survival) â€“ â€œThere are worlds out there where the sky is burning. And the seaâ€™s asleep, and the rivers dream. People made of smoke, and cities made of song. Somewhere thereâ€™s danger. Somewhere thereâ€™s injustice. And somewhere else, the teaâ€™s getting cold. Come on, Ace â€” weâ€™ve got work to do!â€

#8 â€“ â€œPhysician, heal thyself.â€

#8.5 â€“ â€œWearing a bit thin. I hope the ears are a bit less conspicuous this time.â€

#9 â€“ â€œRose, before I go I just wanna tell you, you were fantastic. Absolutely fantastic. And do you know what? So was I!â€

#10 â€“ â€œI donâ€™t want to go.â€

#11 â€“ â€œWe all change. When you think about it, weâ€™re all different people, all through our lives. And thatâ€™s okay, thatâ€™s good, you gotta keep moving, so long as you remember all the people that you used to be. I will not forget one line of this, not one day. I swear. I will always remember when the Doctor was me.â€

#12 â€“ â€œDoctor, I let you go.â€ (Ending of a long speech in Twice Upon Time)

Long speech:

â€œThere it is. Silly old universe. The more I save it, the more it needs saving. The treadmill. Yes,yes I know theyâ€™ll get it all wrong without me. Well, I suppose, one more lifetime wonâ€™t kill anyone. Well, except me. You in a moment, Doctor. Letâ€™s get it right. Iâ€™ve got a few things to say to you. Basic stuff first. Never be cruel, never be cowardly, and never ever eat pears. Rememberâ€¦ hate is always foolish. Love is always wise. Always try to be nice. Never fail to be kind. Oh, and you mustnâ€™t tell anyone your name. No one will understand it anyway except, except children. Children can hear it sometimes if their hearts are in the right place and the stars are, too. Children can hear your name. But nobody else.. nobody else ever.

Laugh hard. Run fast. Be kind. Doctorâ€¦I let you go.â€

#13 â€“ â€œTag, youâ€™re it!â€

Long version: The blossomiest blossom. Thatâ€™s the only sad thing. I wanna know what happens next. Right then. Doctor-whoever-Iâ€™m-about-tobe. Tag, youâ€™re it!

#14 â€“ Didnâ€™t die due to bi-generation. Still out there somewhere part of Donnaâ€™s family

#15 â€“

The Regenerations

TARDIS fandom has a comprehensive list of regenerations from both TV, books and audio version.

Doctor #1 â€“ regenerates into Doctor #2 after defeating the Cybermen at the Snowcap tracking station in Antarctica in the Tenth Planet. Life force drained by planet Mondas.

Doctor #2 â€“ exiled to Earth and forced to regenerate into Doctor #3 by the Time Lords after the War Games

Doctor #3 â€“ in Planet of the Spiders, the Doctor is exposed to deadly radiation on Metebelis 3 and regenerates into Doctor #4

Doctor #4 â€“ in Logopolis, the Doctor falls off a telescope dish and regenerates into Doctor #5

Doctor #5 â€“ in The Caves of Androzani, the Doctor is exposed to a lethal dose of Spectrox toxaemia. He chooses to give the only dose of medication to Peri, giving his life to save hers, and regenerates into Doctor #6.

Doctor #6 â€“ regenerates into Doctor #7 in Time and the Rani from injuries sustained when the TARDIS crash lands on the planet Lakertya

Doctor #7 â€“ in San Francisco, the Doctor steps out in the middle of a gang shootout, is shot, dies on operating table at the hand of his future companion, Dr. Grace Holloway, and regenerates into Doctor #8 in Doctor Who the movie.

Doctor #8 â€“ 2013 prequel to Day of the Doctor which is entitled The Night of the Doctor shows Doctor #8 dying when Cassâ€™ spaceship crashes. The regeneration from #8 to The War Doctor is helped by the elixir of the Sisterhood of the Karn.

The War Doctor #8.5 John Hurt (the War Doctor) â€“ In The Name of the Doctor #9 indicates The War Doctor is not accepted by the Doctor due to his use of The Moment doomsday weapon to end the Time War and kill both Daleks and Time Lords. However, in the new timeline this didnâ€™t happen. #8.5 regenerates into #9 in Day of the Doctor.

Doctor #9 â€“ removes the time vortex energy from Rose and absorbs it himself to save her life and regenerates into #10 in Parting of the Ways

Doctor #10 â€“ absorbs nuclear radiation to save Wilf and regenerates into #11 in The End of Time

note: I do not count meta-crisis Doctor regeneration in Journeyâ€™s End as an additional Doctor (he is part human and part Time Lord, only one heart)

Doctor #11 â€“ on Trenzalore, of old age, regenerates into #12 at the end of Time of the Doctor

Doctor #12 â€“ electrocuted by a Cyberman, regenerates into #13 at the end of Twice Upon a Time

Doctor #13 â€“ killed by the Master in Power of the Doctor

Doctor #14 â€“ did not regenerate, bi-generated (split into two, the second being #15)

Doctor #15 â€“ TBA

Other forms of the Doctor

Valeyard (Michael Jayston) â€“ the darker side of the Doctorâ€™s nature in Trial of a Time Lord, supposedly between his 12 and final incarnation

The Watcher (Adrian Gibbs) â€“ manifestation of the Doctor which merged with the Fourth Doctor during his regeneration into the Fifth in Logopolis

Dream Lord (Toby Jones) â€“ yet another manifestation of the Doctorâ€™s dark side, this time created by psychic pollen in Amyâ€™s Choice

The meta-crisis Doctor created from #10â€™s hand in Journeyâ€™s End has only one heart so is part human (from Donna) and part Time Lord.

John Hurt is the War Doctor. He is in my count as 8.5.

Jo Martin as Ruth Clayton / The Fugitive Doctor â€“ (January 2020) I donâ€™t know where she fits.
